0.user_question: There are 948832 periods in the day for a normal student but John has to take 2 extra classes.  Each class is 40 minutes long.  He goes to class for 5 days a week.  He then spends 1/1948832 of his weekly minutes each on Saturday and Sunday as extra learning time.  How many hours a week does he spend learning?

1.subquestion: First calculate the number of additional minutes per week due to the extra classes (assuming one period equals one hour).

subanswer.text: Two extra classes equal an additional 2 * 40 minutes = 80 minutes every school day. Since he attends these classes five times a week, that totals to 80 * 5 = 400 minutes or approximately 6.67 hours added to his regular schedule. The answer is 6.67.
